member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStrControl.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the stream of the input. Note: although the incoming video to the encoder is paused (frozen), the stream will continue playing and the elapsed time counter will continue in the paused state. This allows a freeze frame to be displayed if the user does not want live video to be transmitted. This property is not supported by "DmNvxD30", "DmNvxD30C", "DmNvx350", "DmNvx350C", "DmNvx351", "DmNvx351C", "DmNvxD30", "DmNvxD30C", "DmNvxE30", "DmNvxE30C", "DmNvxE31" and "DmNvxE31C" devices.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStrControl.eSessionInitiation.ByReceiver
member.summary: The card waits for a connection from a receiving device. The client connects to the URL specified in and the server connects to the URL specified in the . This is a unicast stream. If multiple clients connect, the packets are duplicated for each client. For example, if the DMC-STRO is configured to provide a 5000kbps stream and one client connects, 5000kbps is generated. However, if a second client connects, the stream is duplicated consuming 10kbps total. The DMC-STRO can support up to 25000kbps after which point, degradation in the video quality may be observed. There is no limit imposed to the number of connections allowed.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStrControl.eSessionInitiation.ByTransmitter
member.summary: The transmitter connects to the IP specified in . In this case, there is not RTSP exchange, so the decoder must be prepared to receive the stream. Consult your decoderâ€™s documentation to configure it to receive streams.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStrControl.eSessionInitiation.MulticastViaRTSP
member.summary: Multicast via RTSP. The device still accepts RTSP requests, but sends back a multicast address instead of unicasting. This is useful when you need to setup one stream and then have all touch panels connect to it. The multicast address is specified in . The client connects to the address specified in and the server connects to the URL specified in the .

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStrControl.eSessionInitiation.MulticastViaUDP
member.summary: The device streams raw UPD to a multicast address and does not have RTSP. The stream is always on and clients can connect to it (this also has the advantage of not needing to restart the stream if something goes wrong).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStriControl.OnlineFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running) This property is applicable only when the DM Card is connected to a .
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStriControl.PresentFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the . The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed. This property is applicable only when the DM Card is connected to a Switcher.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.DeviceReadyFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the device is ready to start streaming or preview video. The device may not be ready if the IP address has changed or another system event has caused a re-configuration. The appropriate feedback for those parameters should be checked to ensure that the stream starts correctly. Start signals will be ignored until the device is ready to start streaming. true = Device is ready; false = Device is not ready.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.UsbMode
member.summary: Property to select the mode of the Icron device. If this property is not supported by the device then is returned.
member.exception: Value passed for USB mode is not defined in the enum .

member.summary:
Property to report the current mode of the Icron device. If this property is not supported by the device then is returned.

member.remarks: If a combination is not supported, the input value should be ignored.

member.summary:
Property to feedback the currently active video source for the encoder / HDMI output if is false and is true.
The event will trigger with . This property is not supported by DMF-XX-4K-SFP,"DmNvxD30","DmNvxD30C","DmNvxE30","DmNvxE30C","DmNvxE31" and "DmNvxE31C" devices.
member.remarks: If this property is not initialized, the default value will be returned.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.AnalogAudioOutputVolume
member.summary: Property to set the volume of the stream. Valid values range from -800 (-80dB) to +240 (+24dB), where 1 = 0.1dB Note, steps are in 0.5 db, out of range values will be rounded to the closest 0.5 db.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.AnalogAudioOutputVolumeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current volume of the stream. Valid values range from -800 (-80dB) to +240 (+24dB), where 1 = 0.1dB Note, steps are in 0.5 db, out of range values will be rounded to the closest 0.5 db.
The event will trigger with .

member.exception: Value passed for Fan Control is not defined in the enum .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.ChassisSerialNumberFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the serial number of the chassis where the DM-NVX-35xC is installed. This property is supported only for "DmNvx350","DmNvx350C","DmNvx351" and "DmNvx351C" devices only. Maximum length of the string is 200 characters.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.CardSlotInfoFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current slot of a DM-NVX-35xC installed in a chassis. This property is supported only for "DmNvx350","DmNvx350C","DmNvx351" and "DmNvx351C" devices only. Maximum length of the string is 200 characters.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.DanteAes67Name
member.summary: Property to set the name of the Dante/AES67 module which will appear in the dante controller. By default this name will consist of the product name and a combination of the DM-NVX mac address and Audinate mac address. This property is supported only for "DmNvx352" and "DmNvx352C" devices only. Maximum length is 32 characters.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxControl.DanteAes67NameFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the name of the Dante/AES67 module which will appear in the dante controller. By default this name will consist of the product name and a combination of the DM-NVX mac address and Audinate mac address. This property is supported only for "DmNvx352" and "DmNvx352C" devices only. Maximum length is 32 characters. DM-NVX-352-xxxxxxyyyyyy x = last 6 characters of DM-NVX Mac address y = last 6 characters of Audinate Mac address
The event will trigger with .

the specific type of internal device class. member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxBaseClass.DmNvx35xSecondaryAudio.eSecondaryAudioMode
member.summary: Enum to define the Secondary Audio Modes.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxBaseClass.DmNvx35xSecondaryAudio.eSecondaryAudioMode.Automatic
member.summary:
Automatic Mode In transmitter mode, sends the secondary audio stream to a multicast address 1 greater than the primary stream. For example, if the address is 239.1.2.3 for the primary, the secondary stream should be at 1.2.4. All controls on this slot are ignored when in this mode except for AudioSource. In receiver mode, the goal of this mode is to provide the highest quality audio that is available in the audio path. If = . If the receiver does not have a DSP and the primary stream has multichannel audio, sends the multichannel audio to the HDMI output, Attempts to connect to the secondary audio channel on +1 the multicast address.
If the receiver device has a DSP, Selects the , and uses the DSP to downmix the audio for the analog audio connector. If = , attempts to connect to the secondary stream. All controls on this slot are ignored except for . For DM-NVX-D80-IOAV only: The goal of this mode is to provide the highest quality audio that is available in the audio path If Top.AudioSource = Primary If the receiver has a DSP: Select the primary audio stream, and use the DSP to downmix the audio for the analog audio connector. If the receiver does not have a DSP: If the audio in the primary stream is multichannel Send the multichannel audio to the HDMI output Attempt to connect to a secondary audio channel on +1 the multicast address If the audio stream is found, decode it and send it to the analog output. Otherwise mute the analog output. If Top.AudioSource = Secondary, attempt to connect to the secondary stream. All controls on this slot are ignored except for AudioSource. If = . Selects the , and uses the DSP to downmix the audio for the analog audio connector. If = , attempts to connect to the secondary stream. All controls on this slot are ignored except for . For DM-NAX-ROUTING only: When in transmitter mode: Send the secondary audio stream to a multicast address 1 greater than the primary stream. For example, if the address is 239.1.2.3 for the primary, the secondary stream should be at 239.1.2.4. All controls on this slot are ignored when in this mode with the exception of the property. When in receiver mode: The goal of this mode is to provide the highest quality audio that is available in the audio path. If Top.AudioSource = Primary If the receiver has a DSP: Select the primary audio stream, and use the DSP to downmix the audio for the analog audio connector. If the receiver does not have a DSP: If the audio in the primary stream is multichannel Send the multichannel audio to the HDMI output Attempt to connect to a secondard audio channel on +1 the multicast address If the audio stream is found, decode it and send it to the analog output. Otherwise mute the analog output. If Top.AudioSource = Secondary, attempt to connect to the secondary stream. All controls on are ignored except for .

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxBaseClass.DmNvx35xSecondaryAudio.eSecondaryAudioMode.Manual
member.summary: Manual Mode In transmitter mode, sends the secondary stream to the location specified on this slot. All controls on this slot are honored in this mode. In receiver mode, receives the secondary stream to the location specified on this slot. All controls on this slot are honored in this mode.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvxBaseClass.DmNvx35xSecondaryAudio.eSecondaryAudioMode.Disabled
member.summary: Disabled In transmitter mode, shall not send the stream. In receiver mode, shall not attempt to find a secondary stream.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco80
member.summary:
The DMCO-80 is an output card compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. It contains a DMC-4K-CO. This card is the upgrade for the DMCO-50. The DMC-4K-CO provides two 4K compliant DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1 and DM OUT 2. Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco88
member.summary:
The DMCO-88 is an output card compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. This card is the upgrade for the DMCO-55. It represents two DMC-4K-CO cards. It provides 4 4K compliant DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1, 2, 3, and 4. Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. Each DMC-4K-CO also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. Each DMC-4K-CO also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco83
member.summary:
The DMCO-83 is an output card compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. This card is the upgrade for the DMCO-85. It represents one DMC-4K-CO and one DMC-HDO card. The DMC-4K-CO provides 2 4K compliant DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1, 2, 3, and 4. Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. Each DMC-4K-CO also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. Each DMC-4K-CO also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device. The DMC-HDO provides two HDMI outputs, labeled HDMI 1 and 2. Two stereo audio outputs break out the stereo audio signal from each HDMI output and pass it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Endpoints.Transmitters.DmTx4k202C
member.summary:
The DM-TX-4K-202-C is a DigitalMedia audio/video switcher and transmitter.
The transmitter distributes uncompressed digital video and audio signals over copper-based Ethernet cabling
This device does not support ComPort extended information events.
This class will trigger , , , , , , and events.
member.exception: No valid DM Input port is present in the specified 'paramDmInput' object.

member.summary: Selects the video source to route to the video output on DM Lite Transmitter Valid values range from 300 (no source) to 305. 300 = DM Lite In Transmitter No Route (not supported Day 1) 301 = DM Lite In Transmitter Input 1 302 = DM Lite In Transmitter Input 2 303 = DM Lite In Transmitter Input 3 304/305 = DM Lite In Transmitter Input 4 (future TX) Invalid values are ignored for the receiver inputs as well as transmitter inputs.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.HdRx4kX10DmLiteInputPort.Priority
member.summary:
Gets/Sets the input priority. The range is 1 to 4 based on the number of local inputs on the device. Transmitters connected to DM Lite inputs will each have a separate Priority setting with a maximum value equal to the total number of transmitter inputs. This property only works if Auto Route is enabled. This property is supported by HD-RX-4K-210 devices only.
The event will trigger with .

member.summary: Pauses the stream of the input. Note: although the incoming video to the encoder is paused (frozen), the stream will continue playing and the elapsed time counter will continue in the paused state. This allows a freeze frame to be displayed if the user does not want live video to be transmitted.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kzCDsp
member.summary: The DMCI-DMC-4KZ-C-DSP provides (1) DigitalMedia (DM) input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card. The card also provides (1) PoE (Power over Ethernet) connector labeled POE IN that can supply power to the connected transmitter. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the transmitter. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kzC
member.summary: The DMCI-DMC-4KZ-C provides (1) DigitalMedia (DM) input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card. The card also provides (1) PoE (Power over Ethernet) connector labeled POE IN that can supply power to the connected transmitter. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the transmitter. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMd8x8
member.summary: Crestron DigitalMedia switchers provide digital multi-channel "audio-follows-video" matrix switching, plus independent stereo matrix switching for audio breakaway. The switcher distributes uncompressed digital video and audio signals over DM, which consists of a Shielded Twisted Pair (STP), CAT5e and 4-wire DMNET. The switcher can also route any USB-capable input to any output.

member.summary: Enables audio breakaway for as long as the input is 'true'. This allows audio to be routed independently from video. If audio breakaway is not enabled, the audio routes will follow the selected video routes. 'true' (level-sensitive) = Enable audio breakaway; 'false' = Disable audio breakaway

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.FrontPanelLockOnFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the front panel is locked. The output remains 'true' for as long as the front panel is locked. 'true' = Front panel locked; 'false' = Front panel not locked
The event will trigger with the .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.FrontPanelLockOffFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the front panel is unlocked. The output remains 'true' for as long as the front panel is unlocked. 'true' = Front panel unlocked; 'false' = Front panel not unlocked
The event will trigger with the .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.SavingSettingsFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the save operation is in progress. The output will remain 'true' while the save operation is in progress (usually a few seconds) and then go 'false' when the save operation is complete. 'true' = Saving settings; 'false' = Save settings complete
The event will trigger with the .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.SystemId
member.summary: If Private Network Mode (PNM) is enabled, sets the System ID. Does not take effect until the "ApplySystemId" is called.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.SystemIdFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the current System ID (if Private Network Mode is enabled).
The event will trigger with the .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.SystemIdBusy
member.summary:
Indicates that the changing the System ID operation is in progress. The output will remain 'true' while the changing the System ID operation is in progress (usually a few seconds) and then go 'false' when the operation is complete. 'true' = Changing System ID; 'false' = Changing System ID complete
The event will trigger with the .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.FrontPanelPassword
member.summary: Front Panel Password (Integer)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMDMnxn.FrontPanelPasswordFeedback
member.summary: Reports the front panel password.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMd8x8Cpu3
member.summary: Crestron DigitalMedia switchers provide digital multi-channel "audio-follows-video" matrix switching, plus independent stereo matrix switching for audio breakaway. The switcher distributes uncompressed digital video and audio signals over DM, which consists of a Shielded Twisted Pair (STP), CAT5e and 4-wire DMNET. The switcher can also route any USB-capable input to any output. This switch is bsed on CPU3 Card.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMd8x8rps
member.summary: The DM-MD-Series switcher with RPS (Redundant Power Supply) is a DigitalMedia switcher that provides digital multi-channel "audio-follows-video" matrix switching, plus independent stereo matrix switching for audio breakaway. The switcher distributes uncompressed digital video and audio signals over DM, which consists of a Shielded Twisted Pair (STP), CAT5e and 4-wire DMNET. The switcher can also route any USB data between USB hosts and devices. The DM-MD8X8-RPS provides (2) two internal 12VDC power supplies.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Endpoints.Receivers.DmRmc4kScalerC
member.summary:
4K DigitalMedia 8G+ Receiver and Room Controller w/Scaler, which provides an advanced one-box interface solution for a single display device as part of a complete Crestron DigitalMedia system. It functions as a DM 8G+ receiver, 4K video scaler, and control interface, providing a single HDMI output along with an analog audio output, plus Ethernet, RS-232, IR, and relay control ports. Designed for mounting easily behind a flat panel display or above a ceiling-mounted projector.
This device does not support ComPort extended information events.
This class will trigger , , , , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Endpoints.Receivers.DmRmc4kScalerCDsp
member.summary:
4K DigitalMedia 8G+ Receiver and Room Controller w/Scaler and Downmixing, which provides an advanced one-box interface solution for a single display device as part of a complete Crestron DigitalMedia system. It functions as a DM 8G+ receiver, 4K video scaler, and control interface, providing a single HDMI output along with an analog audio output, plus Ethernet, RS-232, IR, and relay control ports. In addition to DM 8G+, it is also compatible with HDBaseT, allowing it to be connected directly to an HDBaseT certified source. Designed for mounting easily behind a flat panel display or above a ceiling-mounted projector.
This device does not support ComPort extended information events.
This class will trigger , , , , , , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcC
member.summary: The DMCI-DMC-C provides (1) DigitalMedia (DM) input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card. The card also provides (1) PoE (Power over Ethernet) connector labeled POE IN that can supply power to the connected transmitter. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the transmitter. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.summary: Sets the volume level at the DAC output. "DAC" (digital-to-analog converter) refers the RCA stereo analog output (AUDIO OUT L/R). Valid values range from 0 (-80dB) to 65535 (0dB). On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcC.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the DMC-C(DSP) card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true' = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcC.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the DMC-C(DSP) card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true' = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kC
member.summary: The DMCI-DMC-4K-C provides (1) DigitalMedia (DM) input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card. The card also provides (1) PoE (Power over Ethernet) connector labeled POE IN that can supply power to the connected transmitter. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the transmitter. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcSBase.Audio
member.summary: Sets the volume level at the DAC output. "DAC" (digital-to-analog converter) refers the RCA stereo analog output (AUDIO OUT L/R). Valid values range from 0 (-80dB) to 65535 (0dB). On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcSBase.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcSBase.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcS2
member.summary: The DMC-S2 is a DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ single mode fiber video card compatible with the input card slots of a DigitalMedia switcher. The video card provides (1) DigitalMedia LC input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card, with a maximum length over 10 miles. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local display device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcS2Dsp
member.summary: The DMC-S2-DSP is a DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ single mode fiber video card compatible with the input card slots of a DigitalMedia switcher. The video card provides (1) DigitalMedia LC input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card, with a maximum length over 10 miles. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local display device. The DSP model includes an internal DSP to enable the simultaneous distribution of uncompressed 7.1 channel HD surround sound and 2-channel audio.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcS
member.summary: The DMC-S is a DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ multimode fiber video card compatible with the input card slots of a DigitalMedia switcher. The video card provides (1) DigitalMedia SC input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card, with a maximum length of 1000 feet. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local display device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcSDsp
member.summary: The DMC-S-DSP is a DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ multimode fiber video card compatible with the input card slots of a DigitalMedia switcher. The video card provides (1) DigitalMedia SC input connector labeled DM IN that receives video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data from a DM transmitter or output card, with a maximum length of 1000 feet. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides one HDMI output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local display device. The DSP model includes an internal DSP to enable the simultaneous distribution of uncompressed 7.1 channel HD surround sound and 2-channel audio.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcSdi
member.summary: The DMC-SDI is an SDI video card. The card supports SD-SDI, HD-SDI and 3G-SDI formats, handling high-definition video signals up to 1080p60, and up to 8 channels of 24-bit digital audio. The DMC-SDI provides (1) SDI input labeled SDI IN. An SDI loop-through output (labeled SDI OUT) is included for connection to a local monitor or other SDI device. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the SDI input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The card also provides (1) HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local display device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcDvi
member.summary: The DMC-DVI is a DVI/RGB video card. The DMC-DVI provides one DVI digital video input or analog RGB/YPbPr input (labeled DVI-I) and a balanced/unbalanced audio input (labeled AUDIO IN) that accepts stereo line-level audio. The USB HID port is a Type B port for connection to a USB host. The DMC-DVI also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.summary: Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcDvi.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcDvi.FreeRunFeedback
member.summary: Reports the status of free run mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcDvi.FreeRun
member.summary: Enabled or disabled free run mode.
member.remarks: When in free run mode the card will generate a solid black 640x480 video signal when there is no input signal detected. This allows audio to be carried to the backplane for routing.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcDvi.TypeControl
member.summary: Sets the video type of this source image.
member.remarks: When using S-Video or composite, this input must be used to force the video type. Auto-mode will detected RGB or component video when present. Auto-mode will also allow blank video to be transmitted (for support of stand-alone audio) when no video input is present. That is, if "Source Type Control" is set to RGB, YPbPr, S-Video, or Composite, the blank frame will not be sent and audio cannot be transmitted.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kzHd
member.summary: The DMC-4KZ-HD provides 1 HDMI input labeled HDMI IN. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the HDMI input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The USB HID port is a Type B port for connection to a USB host. The DMC-4KZ-HD also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.
member.remarks: symlib_DMC-4KZ-HD.tio 1.010 12/14/2017 02:06:14AM DMC-4KZ-HD iodev_DMC-4KZ-HD.tio 1.010 12/14/2017 02:06:14AM DMC-4KZ-HD

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kzHdDsp
member.summary: The DMC-4KZ-HD-DSP provides 1 HDMI input labeled HDMI IN. The DMC-4KZ-HD-DSP provides all of the features of the DMC-HD with the addition of internal DSP to enable the simultaneous distribution of uncompressed 7.1 channel HD surround sound and 2-channel audio. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the HDMI input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The USB HID port is a Type B port for connection to a USB host. The DMC-4KZ-HD-DSP also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.summary: Sets the volume level at the DAC output. "DAC" (digital-to-analog converter) refers the RCA stereo analog output (AUDIO OUT L/R). Valid values range from 0 (-80dB) to 65535 (0dB). On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kHdDspBase.OnlineFeedback

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kHdDspBase.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.HdRx4k410CE
member.summary:
The HD-RX-4K-410-C-E switch that provides enhanced remote HDMI video source switching and audio presentation capability for the commercial market meeting rooms and learning spaces. Its capabilities are designed specifically with providing a budget-friendly solution to the commercial market between the existing HD-MD-400-C-E solution and the DMPS3-4K-150-C product line.
This class will trigger , , , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcHd
member.summary: The DMC-HD is an HDMI video card compatible with the input card slots of the DigitalMedia switcher. The DMC-HD provides 1 HDMI input labeled HDMI IN. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the HDMI input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The USB HID port is a Type B port for connection to a USB host. The DMC-HD also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcHd.#ctor(System.UInt32,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronControlSystem)
member.summary:
Card Constructor for an external DMCI version of this card.
DMInputEvents that would have triggered the Switcher's DMInputChange event will trigger the BaseEvent for this class.
member.param: The cresnet ID of the card.
ControlSystem this device is attached to.
member.exception: The cresnet ID specified is in use or invalid.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcHd.Audio
member.summary: Sets the volume level at the DAC output. "DAC" (digital-to-analog converter) refers the RCA stereo analog output (AUDIO OUT L/R). Valid values range from 0 (-80dB) to 65535 (0dB). On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcHd.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcHd.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kHdDsp
member.summary: The DMC-4K-HD-DSP provides 1 HDMI input labeled HDMI IN. The DMC-4K-HD-DSP provides all of the features of the DMC-HD with the addition of internal DSP to enable the simultaneous distribution of uncompressed 7.1 channel HD surround sound and 2-channel audio. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the HDMI input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The USB HID port is a Type B port for connection to a USB host. The DMC-4K-HD-DSP also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.HdMd8x1
member.summary: The Crestron HD-MD8x1 is a DigitalMedia switcher that provides "audio-follows-video" switching, plus independent stereo matrix switching for audio breakaway. The switcher distributes High-Definition video and audio signals over HDMI to a video display or processor, such as the Crestron AMS. The HD-MD8X1 provides (8) HDMI 1.3a inputs (labeled INPUT 1 through INPUT 8), and (1) HDMI output (labeled OUTPUT 1).

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.HdMd8x2
member.summary: The Crestron HD-MD8x2 is a DigitalMedia switcher that provides "audio-follows-video" matrix switching, plus independent stereo matrix switching for audio breakaway. The switcher distributes High-Definition video and audio signals over HDMI to a video display or processor, such as the Crestron AMS. The HD-MD8X2 provides (8) HDMI 1.3a inputs (labeled INPUT 1 through INPUT 8), and (2) HDMI outputs (labeled OUTPUT 1 and 2).

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcCat
member.summary: The DMC-CAT provides (1) set of (2) RJ45 Digital Media inputs, labeled "D" and "M". The "D" input receives video and audio from the "D" output of a DM transmitter or output card. The "M" input receives HDCP, EDID, and USB data from the "M" output of the DM transmitter or output card. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the HDMI input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The USB HID port is a Type B port for connection to a USB host. The DMC-CAT also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

ControlSystem this device is attached to.
member.exception: The cresnet ID specified is in use or invalid.

On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcCat.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcCatDsp
member.summary: The DMC-CAT-DSP provides (1) set of (2) RJ45 Digital Media inputs, labeled "D" and "M". The "D" input receives video and audio from the "D" output of a DM transmitter or output card.The "M" input receives HDCP, EDID, and USB data from the "M" output of the DM transmitter or output card. The DMC-CAT-DSP provides an internal DSP to enable the simultaneous distribution of uncompressed 7.1 channel HD surround sound and 2-channel audio. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the HDMI input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system. The USB HID port is a Type B port for connection to a USB host. The DMC-CAT-DSP also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMd6x4
member.summary: The DM-MD6x4 is a DigitalMedia 8G+â„¢ audio/video switcher and distribution center. The DM-MD6x4 provides (6) six HDMI inputs that support HDMI, DVI and DisplayPort Multimode signals types. The switcher provides (1) one HDMI output and (3) three DM 8G+ STP outputs (DigitalMedia over single shielded twisted-pair copper wire). The USB HID output port is a Type B port for connection to a USB HID-compliant host.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.DmMd6x6
member.summary: The DM-MD6x6 is a DigitalMedia 8G+â„¢ audio/video switcher and distribution center. The DM-MD6x6 provides (6) six HDMI inputs that support HDMI, DVI and DisplayPort Multimode signal types. The switcher provides (1) one HDMI output and (5) five DM 8G+ STP outputs (DigitalMedia over single shielded twisted-pair copper wire). The USB HID output port is a Type B port for connection to a USB HID-compliant host.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmc4kzCoB
member.summary:
The DMC-4KZ-CO is an output card compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The DMC-4KZ-HD provides two 4K compliant DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1 and DM OUT 2. Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device. In this case, DM OUT 1 is and DM OUT 2 is .
This class will trigger and events.

The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. member.summary:
Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the . The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true' = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcCoBaseB.OnlineFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true' = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)
The event will trigger with .

The DMC-4KZ-CO is an output card compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The DMC-4KZ-HD provides two 4K compliant DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1 and DM OUT 2. Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device. In this case, DM OUT 1 is and DM OUT 2 is .
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.HdRx4k210CE
member.summary:
The HD-RX-4K-210-C-E switch that provides enhanced remote HDMI video source switching and audio presentation capability for the commercial market meeting rooms and learning spaces. Its capabilities are designed specifically with providing a budget-friendly solution to the commercial market between the existing HD-MD-400-C-E solution and the DMPS3-4K-150-C product line.
This class will trigger , , , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.DmNvx363C
member.summary:
Standalone High Speed DM 4K Streaming Device with Streaming In and Streaming Out features. This device offers Dante and DSP for multi channel audio down mix. Features include 3 Copper network ports, and 1 fiber port USB Device port, as well as a host and HID port Single HDMI output (Loop mout in TX/Scaled in RX) Single HDMI input Audio insert/extract DM NAX audio (AES67)

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVidBnc
member.summary: The DMC-VID-BNC is a BNC video input card compatible with the input card slots of the DigitalMedia switcher. The DMC-VID-BNC provides (1) set of (3) BNC video inputs that accept composite video, S-Video and component HDTV signals, and a balanced/unbalanced audio input (labeled AUDIO IN) that accepts stereo line-level audio. The DMC-VID-BNC also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVidRcaA
member.summary: The DMC-VID-RCA-D is an input card compatible with the input card slots of the DigitalMedia switcher. The DMC-VID-RCA-D provides one analog video input and one S/PDIF coaxial digital audio input. The DMC-VID-RCA-D accepts composite video, S-Video and component HDTV signals. The S/PDIF input supports 2-channel stereo and 5.1 surround-encoded digital audio sources. The DMC-VID-RCA-D also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4
member.summary: The DMC-VID4 is a security camera card compatible with the input card slots of the DigitalMedia switcher. The DMC-VID4 provides 4 RCA composite video inputs labeled COMPOSITE IN 1 through COMPOSITE IN 4. Up to four security cameras can be viewed simultaneously in four video windows, each with dynamic colored text overlay. The DMC-VID4 also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.FullSizeImage
member.summary: Enables full-size image mode on the rising edge of the input. This displays the camera input specified by "Select_Full_Screen_Image" in full size. If the selected camera is disabled or no video is detected, a blue screen will be displayed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.MultiviewImage
member.summary: Enables multi-view mode. In this mode the video layout is determined by the camera status, as follows: If no cameras are enabled (or detected), "No Available Sources" will be displayed on the screen. If one camera is enabled/detected, the video from that camera will be displayed full screen. If two cameras are enabled/detected, the video will be displayed in dual window layout, where the lower numbered camera is on the left and the higher numbered camera is on the right. If three or four cameras are enabled/detected, the video will be displayed in quad layout, as follows:COMPOSITE IN 1 = Top leftCOMPOSITE IN 2 = Top rightCOMPOSITE IN 3 = Bottom leftCOMPOSITE IN 4 = Bottom rightIn quad mode, if only three cameras are enabled/detected, the disabled camera will be displayed in blue.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.EnableFullSizeImageCycle
member.summary: Enables full-size image cycling. In this mode the display cycles from one camera input to the next in full size, at the rate specified by "Image_Rotate_Rate". The cameras cycle sequentially from 1 through 4.If a camera is disabled/not detected, it will be skipped in the sequence. If no cameras are enabled/detected, "No Available Sources" will be displayed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.DisableFullSizeImageCycle
member.summary: Disables cycle mode

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.DMinput_OnBaseChange(Crestron.SimplSharpProInternal.CrestronDevice,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.SigEventArgs)
member.summary: Service the Input group

member.summary: HDMI out port

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.FullSizeImageFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the screen is currently in full-size mode. The output remains 'true' for as long as the image is in full size. 'true' = Full-size active; 'false' = Full-size release

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.MultiviewImageFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the screen is set to multi-view mode. The output remains 'true' for as long as the video is being displayed in multi-view mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.EnableFullSizeImageCycleFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the display is currently in cycle mode. The output remains 'true' for as long as the display is cycling. 'true' = Cycle mode enabled; 'false' = Cycle mode released

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.DisableFullSizeImageCycleFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that cycle mode is disabled. The output remains 'true for as long as cycle mode is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.SelectFullScreenImage
member.summary: When full-size display is enabled ("Full_Size_Image_fb" = 'true') selects the video input to display

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.SelectFullScreenImageFeedback
member.summary: Reports the camera input currently being displayed in full-size.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVid4.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.HdRx4k510CE
member.summary:
The HD-RX-4K-510-C-E switch that provides enhanced remote HDMI video source switching and audio presentation capability for the commercial market meeting rooms and learning spaces. Its capabilities are designed specifically with providing a budget-friendly solution to the commercial market between the existing HD-MD-400-C-E solution and the DMPS3-4K-150-C product line.
This class will trigger , , , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco30
member.summary:
The DMC-HDO provides two HDMI outputs, labeled HDMI 1 and 2. Two stereo audio outputs break out the stereo audio signal from each HDMI output and pass it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcCatoHdA
member.summary:
The DMC-CATO-HD provides two RJ45 Digital Media (DM) outputs, labeled "D" and "M". The "D" output transmits video and audio to the "D" input of a DigitalMedia receiver. The "M" output transmits HDCP, EDID, and USB data to the "M" input of the DM receiver. The DMC-CATO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM Output #1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a remote display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.summary:
Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true' = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcCatoHdB.OnlineFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true' = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)
The event will trigger with .

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcFo
member.summary:
The DMC-FO is an output card compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The DMC-FO provides two fiber optic Digital Media (DM) outputs, each labeled "D" and "M". The "D" output transmits video and audio to the "D" input of a DigitalMedia receiver such as the . The "M" output transmits HDCP, EDID, and USB data to the "M" input of the DM receiver.
This class will trigger and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcSoHdA
member.summary:
The DMC-SO-HD and DMC-S2O-HD are output cards compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The card provides two (2) DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) that transmit video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DigitalMedia receiver such as the . The card also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with the DM port. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcS2oHdA
member.summary:
The DMC-SO-HD and DMC-S2O-HD are output cards compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The card provides two (2) DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) that transmit video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DigitalMedia receiver such as the DM-RMC-100-S. The card also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with Output 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device. The S2 version employs a different type of fiber that travels over 50 times further than the S version.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcCoHdB
member.summary:
The DMC-CO-HD is an output card compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The DMC-CO-HD provides two DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1 and DM OUT 2. Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device. In this case, DM OUT 1 is and DM OUT 2 is .
This class will trigger and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroAV
member.summary:
The DMC-STRO is a streaming output card with video and audio mixing capabilities which can generate streams of up to 25 megabits. To be matched precisely to your environment the card has been designed to allow flexibility in network design; the stream can either be routed out via the Content LAN port, or the DM's internal Ethernet. In automatic mode (default), the DMC-STRO will stream out via the Content LAN port if link is detected, otherwise it will use the internal DM Ethernet.
This class will trigger and events.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroAV.EnablePipSwap
member.summary: Enables swapping of the background and the PIP (Picture in Picture) video windows on the rising edge of the input. For side-by-side the two streams will be switched. For full-frames, the image from source 2 will be displayed instead of source 1. This allows for very fast switching. This switches the video windows so that the source in the PIP window becomes the background and vice versa. The audio will be heard from whichever source is in the background (large) window.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroAV.DisablePiPSwap
member.summary: Returns the swapped background and PIP (Picture in Picture) video windows to normal order.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroAV.PipFullframe
member.summary: Recalls the predefined full frame view, i.e. displays the stream from the PIP window in a full frame window view of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroAV.PipSideBySide
member.summary: The input recalls the predefined full frame view, i.e. creates two equal sized windows displayed side by side, one with the video from the PIP window, and the other one with video from the background.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroAV.PipUpperLeft
member.summary: Recalls the corresponding predefined PIP view (upper left, center left, lower left, upper right, center right or lower right) of the input.

This is also used to adjust the size of the side-by-side windows, allowing one window to be larger than the other. member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroControl
member.summary:
The DMC-STRO is a streaming output card with video and audio mixing capabilities which can generate streams of up to 25 megabits. To be matched precisely to your environment the card has been designed to allow flexibility in network design; the stream can either be routed out via the Content LAN port, or the DM's internal Ethernet. In automatic mode (default), the DMC-STRO will stream out via the Content LAN port if link is detected, otherwise it will use the internal DM Ethernet.
This class will trigger event.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcStroControl.EncoderReadyFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates if the encoder is ready to start streaming. The encoder may not be ready if the IP address has changed or another system event has caused a reconfiguration. Start signals will be ignored until the encoder is ready to start streaming. 'true' = Encoder is ready; 'false' = Encoder is not ready.
The event will trigger with .

member.summary: Enabled or disabled free run mode.
member.remarks: When in free run mode the card will generate a solid black 640x480 video signal when there is no input signal detected. This allows audio to be carried to the backplane for routing.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcVga.TypeControl
member.summary: Sets the video type of this source image.
member.remarks: When using S-Video or composite, this input must be used to force the video type. Auto-mode will detected RGB or component video when present. Auto-mode will also allow blank video to be transmitted (for support of stand-alone audio) when no video input is present. That is, if "Source Type Control" is set to RGB, YPbPr, S-Video, or Composite, the blank frame will not be sent and audio cannot be transmitted.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Streaming.Overlay.TextOverlayProperties.ScrollEnable
member.summary: Method to enable text scrolling, the text specified in the shall be smoothly scrolled from left to right at the rate specified in . The text shall scroll until no text is visible, then wait one-second and then begin scrolling again. This method is not supported by DMF-XX-4K-SFP and HD-WP-4K-401-C devices.

member.summary:
The DMC-SO-HD and DMC-S2O-HD are output cards compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The card provides two (2) DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) that transmit video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DigitalMedia receiver such as the DM-RMC-100-S.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco43
member.summary:
The card provides two (2) DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) and two HDMI outputs. The card also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with Output 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco45
member.summary:
The card provides two (2) DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) and two DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1 and DM OUT 2. Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The card also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with Output 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.summary:
Sets the volume level at the output. "DAC" (digital-to-analog converter) refers the RCA stereo analog output (AUDIO OUT L/R). Valid values range from 0 (-80dB) to 65535 (0dB). On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect.
This property will trigger with for object.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco50
member.summary:
The DMC-CO-HD provides two DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1(DmcCoHdA) and DM OUT 2(DmcCoHdB). Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco53
member.summary:
Provides two DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1(DmcCoHdA) and DM OUT 2(DmcCoHdB). Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device. Also provides two HDMI outputs, labeled HDMI 1 and 2. Two stereo audio outputs break out the stereo audio signal from each HDMI output and pass it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco55
member.summary:
The DMC-CO-HD provides four DigitalMedia (DM) output connectors labeled DM OUT 1(DmcCoHdA) and DM OUT 2(DmcCoHdB). Each DM output transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco60
member.summary:
DMC-S2O-HD are output cards compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The card provides two (2) DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) that transmit video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DigitalMedia receiver such as the DM-RMC-100-S. The S2 version employs a different type of fiber that travels over 50 times further than the S version.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco64
member.summary:
DMC-S2O-HD are output cards compatible with the output card slots of a DMCO enclosure. The card provides two (4) DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC. Two are SO type and two are S2O type. (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) that transmit video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DigitalMedia receiver such as the DM-RMC-100-S. The S2 version employs a different type of fiber that travels over 50 times further than the S version.
This class will trigger , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Endpoints.Transmitters.DmTx4kz100C1G
member.summary: The DM-TX-4KZ-100-C-1G is a is a wall plate 4K DigitalMedia HDMI transmitter and control interface that connects to a DMÂ® switcher or receiver over a single CAT (twisted pair) or DM 8GÂ® cable and supports 4K Ultra HD video resolutions up to 4,096 x 2,160 at 24Hz or 3,840 x 2,160 at 30Hz.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Endpoints.Receivers.DmRmc4kzScalerC
member.summary:
4K DigitalMedia 8G+ Receiver and Room Controller w/Scaler, which provides an advanced one-box interface solution for a single display device as part of a complete Crestron DigitalMedia system. It functions as a DM 8G+ receiver, 4K video scaler, and control interface, providing a single HDMI output along with an analog audio output, plus Ethernet, RS-232, IR, and relay control ports. Designed for mounting easily behind a flat panel display or above a ceiling-mounted projector.
This device does not support ComPort extended information events.
This class will trigger , , , , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco70
member.summary:
The DMC-STRO is a streaming output card with video and audio mixing capabilities which can generate streams of up to 25 megabits. To be matched precisely to your environment the card has been designed to allow flexibility in network design; the stream can either be routed out via the Content LAN port, or the DM's internal Ethernet. In automatic mode (default), the DMC-STRO will stream out via the Content LAN port if link is detected, otherwise it will use the internal DM Ethernet. This card also provides a number of streaming methods. Please review all available Session Initiation options to select the proper stream type that best suits your environment.
This class will trigger and events.

member.summary:
The DMCO-73 provides a streaming output card with video and audio mixing capabilities which can generate streams of up to 25 megabits. To be matched precisely to your environment the card has been designed to allow flexibility in network design; the stream can either be routed out via the Content LAN port, or the DM's internal Ethernet. In automatic mode (default), the DMC-STRO will stream out via the Content LAN port if link is detected, otherwise it will use the internal DM Ethernet. This card also provides a number of streaming methods. Please review all available Session Initiation options to select the proper stream type that best suits your environment. Also Provides a DMC-HDO output card. The card provides two stereo audio outputs, break out the stereo audio signal from each HDMI output and pass it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco75
member.summary:
The DMCO-75 provides a streaming output card with video and audio mixing capabilities which can generate streams of up to 25 megabits. To be matched precisely to your environment the card has been designed to allow flexibility in network design; the stream can either be routed out via the Content LAN port, or the DM's internal Ethernet. In automatic mode (default), the DMC-STRO will stream out via the Content LAN port if link is detected, otherwise it will use the internal DM Ethernet. This card also provides a number of streaming methods. Please review all available Session Initiation options to select the proper stream type that best suits your environment. Also Provides a DM output, transmits video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DM receiver. The unit also provides two PoE (Power over Ethernet) connectors labeled POE IN 1 and POE IN 2, that can supply power to the connected receiver. This is accomplished by plugging a PoE injector into the PoE port to feed power down the DM cable to the receiver. The DMC-CO-HD also provides one local HDMI output, configured in parallel with DM OUT 1. The HDMI output carries the same audio and video signals as the corresponding DM output, for feedthrough to a display device.
This class will trigger , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.Dmco76
member.summary:
The DMCO-76 provides a streaming output card with video and audio mixing capabilities which can generate streams of up to 25 megabits. To be matched precisely to your environment the card has been designed to allow flexibility in network design; the stream can either be routed out via the Content LAN port, or the DM's internal Ethernet. In automatic mode (default), the DMC-STRO will stream out via the Content LAN port if link is detected, otherwise it will use the internal DM Ethernet. This card also provides a number of streaming methods. Please review all available Session Initiation options to select the proper stream type that best suits your environment. Also Provides a DigitalMedia 8Gâ„¢ Fiber output connectors labeled MMF/SC (Multi-Mode Fiber/SC-Type Connector) that transmit video, audio, HDCP, EDID and USB data to a DigitalMedia receiver such as the DM-RMC-100-S. The S2 version employs a different type of fiber that travels over 50 times further than the S version.
This class will trigger , , and events.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcF
member.summary: The DMC-F is a video card compatible with the input card slots of a DigitalMedia switcher. The DMC-F provides one DigitalMedia fiber input labeled FIBER IN. The "D" input receives video and audio from the "D" output of a DM fiber transmitter or output card. The "M" input receives HDCP, EDID, and USB data from the "M" input of the DM fiber transmitter or output card. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system.The DMC-F also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcF.#ctor(System.UInt32,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronControlSystem)
member.summary:

DMInputEvents that would have triggered the Switcher's DMInputChange event will trigger the BaseEvent for this class.

member.exception: The cresnet ID specified is in use or invalid.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcF.Audio
member.summary: Sets the volume level at the DAC output. "DAC" (digital-to-analog converter) refers the RCA stereo analog output (AUDIO OUT L/R). Valid values range from 0 (-80dB) to 65535 (0dB). On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcF.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcF.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcFDsp
member.summary: The DMC-F-DSP is a video card compatible with the input card slots of a DigitalMedia switcher. The DMC-F-DSP provides one DigitalMedia fiber input labeled FIBER IN. The "D" input receives video and audio from the "D" output of a DM fiber transmitter or output card. The "M" input receives HDCP, EDID, and USB data from the "M" input of the DM fiber transmitter or output card. The DMC-F-DSP provides an internal DSP to enable the simultaneous distribution of uncompressed 7.1 channel HD surround sound and 2-channel audio. The RCA audio output (labeled AUDIO OUT L/R) breaks out the stereo audio signal from the DM input and passes it through to feed a CNX-PAD8A, AAE, or other multi-room audio distribution system.The DMC-F-DSP also provides one HDMI local output port labeled HDMI OUT for feedthrough to a local device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcFDsp.Audio
member.summary: Sets the volume level at the DAC output. "DAC" (digital-to-analog converter) refers the RCA stereo analog output (AUDIO OUT L/R). Valid values range from 0 (-80dB) to 65535 (0dB). On non-DSP models audio will only be heard if the format is 2-channel PCM. Otherwise the input has no effect

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcFDsp.OnlineFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is online or offline; that is, whether it is running properly (responding to polls) on the internal network. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is online. 'true = Card online (running); 'false' = Card offline (not running)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DM.Cards.DmcFDsp.PresentFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the card is physically plugged into the card slot on the DM switcher. The output will remain 'true' for as long as the card is detected. 'true = Card present; 'false' = Card not installed.
